alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Eastern Ascension; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Southern Livingston; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Western Ascension (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF ST. JOHN THE BAPTIST, CENTRAL ASCENSION, ST. JAMES, NORTHWESTERN ST. CHARLES, CENTRAL LIVINGSTON AND SOUTHERN TANGIPAHOA PARISHES THROUGH 415 PM CDT... At 329 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ponchatoula to near Sorrento. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Gonzales, Reserve, Laplace, Ponchatoula, Gramercy, Lutcher, Sorrento, French Settlement, Albany, Port Vincent, Springfield, Killona, Montz, Edgard, South Vacherie, Convent, North Vacherie, Garyville, and Wallace. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 179 and 214. Interstate 12 between mile markers 26 and 41. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
